title: Authors and Citation
text: CAPEL (2025). HRClusterpath: Package (One Line, Title Case). R package version 0.0.1, https://alxkpl.github.io/HRClusterpath/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {HRClusterpath: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {Alexandre CAPEL},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://alxkpl.github.io/HRClusterpath/}, }

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: HRClusterpath R-package provides tools variable clustering Husler-Reiss models, specially using graphical models structure.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: install package, one can write R-terminal :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: section gives overview package’s tools.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: first method can use package hierarchical clustering (variables) using Clusterpath algorithm applied likelihood precision matrix Husler Reiss graphical model fused-Lasso penalty. can use : get_cluster get optimal cluster fixed parameter \(\lambda\) estimated variogram \(\hat \Gamma\) customizable weights. HR_Clusterpath build list optimal results grid \(\lambda\) standards exponnential weights. gg_cluster provides dendrogram induced results HR_Clusterpath function. others functions analyze results.

title: Gradient descent algorithm for Husler-Reiss graphical models clustering — get_cluster
Gradient descent algorithm for Husler-Reiss graphical models clustering — get_cluster
text: gamma d x d matrix : variogram matrix. weights d x d symmetric matrix zero diagonal. ...  lambda positive number : weight penalty.

title: Gradient descent algorithm for Husler-Reiss graphical models clustering — get_cluster
text: function compute maximum likelihood estimator using cluster-path gradient descent returns estimation clusters corresponding R matrix.

title: Gradient descent algorithm for Husler-Reiss graphical models clustering — get_cluster
code: W <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1,               1, 0, 1, 1,               1, 1, 0, 1,               1, 1, 1, 0), nc = 4) gamma <- generate_random_Gamma(d = 4) #> Error in generate_random_Gamma(d = 4): could not find function "generate_random_Gamma" R <- matrix(c(1,0,0,-1,               0,1,1,-2,               0,1,1,-1,               -1,-2,-1,1), nc = 4) Cluster_HR <- get_cluster(gamma, W, 100) Cluster_HR(R) #> Error in 1:d: argument of length 0

Gradient matrix of distance between two columns — gradient_D2

title: Gradient matrix of distance between two columns — gradient_D2
text: Return functon indices (k', l') computing gradient matrix tilde D^2(r_k', r_l'). See section 4.3.3 cluster document details.

title: Gradient matrix of distance between two columns — gradient_D2
code: R <- matrix(c(-1,0,-2,               0,-3,-1,               -2,-1,-1), 3) clusters <- list(c(1,3), c(2), 4) grad <- gradient_D2(R, clusters) #> Error in gradient_D2(R, clusters): could not find function "gradient_D2" grad(1, 2) #> Error in grad(1, 2): could not find function "grad"

title: Function which merges clusters — merge_clusters
text: Function merges clusters

title: Function which merges clusters — merge_clusters
Function which merges clusters — merge_clusters
text: R K x K symmetric matrix. clusters list vector : vector gives element cluster. eps_f positive number : minimal tolerance merging clusters cost function : Cost function optimisation

title: Function which merges clusters — merge_clusters
text: Returns, merging, list new clusters corresponding R matrix, coefficient new clustered computing averaging coefficient two previous clusters.

title: Function which merges clusters — merge_clusters
code: R <- matrix(c(0.5, -1,               -1, -1), nr = 2) clusters <- list(c(1,3), c(2,4)) W <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1,               1, 0, 1, 1,               1, 1, 0, 1,               1, 1, 1, 0), nc = 4) gamma <- matrix(c(0,2,1,0,                   2,0,4,1,                   1,4,0,7,                   0,1,7,0), nc = 4) cost <- neg_likelihood_pen(gamma, weights, 100000) #> Error in neg_likelihood_pen(gamma, weights, 1e+05): unused argument (1e+05) merge_clusters(R, clusters, cost = cost) #> Error in merge_clusters(R, clusters, cost = cost): could not find function "merge_clusters"

title: Negative log-likelihood computation. — neg_likelihood
text: Negative log-likelihood computation.

title: Negative log-likelihood computation. — neg_likelihood
Negative log-likelihood computation. — neg_likelihood
text: gamma \(d \times d\) matrix: empirical variogram matrix.

title: Negative log-likelihood computation. — neg_likelihood
text: fixed variogram gamma, compute set clusters corresponding \(R\) matrix, value associated negative likelihood defined : $$      L(\Theta) = - \log(|\Theta|_+) - \frac 1 2 \text{tr}(\hat \Gamma \Theta) $$ \(|\cdot|_+\) generalised determinant.

title: Negative log-likelihood computation. — neg_likelihood
code: R <- matrix(c(0.5, -1,               -1, -1), nr = 2) clusters <- list(c(1,3), c(2,4)) gamma <- matrix(c(0, 2, 1, 0,                   2, 0, 4, 1,                   1, 4, 0, 7,                   0, 1, 7, 0), nc = 4) nllh <- neg_likelihood(gamma) nllh(R, clusters) #> [1] 10.72741

title: Computation of the penalised negative log-likelihood — neg_likelihood_pen
Computation of the penalised negative log-likelihood — neg_likelihood_pen
text: gamma d x d matrix : variogram matrix. weights d x d symmetric matrix zero diagonal. lambda positive number : weight penalty.

title: Computation of the penalised negative log-likelihood — neg_likelihood_pen
text: function clusters R matrix compute penalised negative log-likelihood model.

title: Computation of the penalised negative log-likelihood — neg_likelihood_pen
code: R <- matrix(c(0.5, -1,               -1, -1), nr = 2) clusters <- list(c(1,3), c(2,4)) W <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1,               1, 0, 1, 1,               1, 1, 0, 1,               1, 1, 1, 0), nc = 4) gamma <- matrix(c(0,2,1,0,                   2,0,4,1,                   1,4,0,7,                   0,1,7,0), nc = 4) f <- neg_likelihood_pen(gamma, W, 0.5) #> Error in neg_likelihood_pen(gamma, W, 0.5): unused argument (0.5) f(R, clusters) #> Error in f(R, clusters): could not find function "f"

what: Gradient of the negative log likelihood without penalty — nloglike_grad_np
title: Gradient of the negative log likelihood without penalty — nloglike_grad_np
text: Gradient negative log likelihood without penalty

title: Gradient of the negative log likelihood without penalty — nloglike_grad_np
Gradient of the negative log likelihood without penalty — nloglike_grad_np
text: gamma d x d variogram matrix.

title: Gradient of the negative log likelihood without penalty — nloglike_grad_np
text: function R matrix clusters compute gradient matrix negative log likelihood fixed variogram gamma. gradient matrix can computed :   : - dlog = t(U) g(Theta_p) U - 0.5 diag(t(U) g(Theta_p) U) - dtrace = - t(U) gamma U  + 0.5 diag(t(U) gamma U)

title: Gradient of the negative log likelihood without penalty — nloglike_grad_np
code: R <- matrix(c(0.5, -1,               -1, -1), nr = 2) clusters <- list(c(1,3), c(2,4)) gamma <- matrix(c(0,2,1,0,                   2,0,4,1,                   1,4,0,7,                   0,1,7,0), nc = 4) gradient <- nloglike_grad_np(gamma) #> Error in nloglike_grad_np(gamma): could not find function "nloglike_grad_np" gradient(R, clusters) #> Error in gradient(R, clusters): could not find function "gradient"

title: Penalty function. — penalty
text: Penalty function.

title: Penalty function. — penalty
Penalty function. — penalty
text: weights \(d \times d\) symmetric matrix zero diagonal.

title: Penalty function. — penalty
text: fixed weights, returns function compute value penalty chosen clusters corresponding R matrix. recall penalty given : P(R) = sum_k<l W_kl D^2(r_.k, r_.l) W_kl clustered weight clusters k l.

title: Penalty function. — penalty
code: R <- matrix(c(0.5, -1,               -1, -1), nr = 2) clusters <- list(c(1,3), c(2,4)) W <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1,               1, 0, 1, 1,               1, 1, 0, 1,               1, 1, 1, 0), nc = 4) P <- penalty(W) #> Error in penalty(W): could not find function "penalty" P(R, clusters) #> Error in P(R, clusters): could not find function "P"

what: Computation of the penalty's gradient — penalty_grad
title: Computation of the penalty's gradient — penalty_grad
text: Computation penalty's gradient

title: Computation of the penalty's gradient — penalty_grad
Computation of the penalty's gradient — penalty_grad
text: weights d x d symmetric matrix zero diagonal.

title: Computation of the penalty's gradient — penalty_grad
text: function clusters corresponding R matrix. Compute gradient fixed weight. expression gradient just weighted sum gradient tilde D^2 weights clustered weights. See equations section 4.3.3 details.

title: Computation of the penalty's gradient — penalty_grad
code: R <- matrix(c(0.5, -1,               -1, -1), nr = 2) clusters <- list(c(1,3), c(2,4)) W <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1,               1, 0, 1, 1,               1, 1, 0, 1,               1, 1, 1, 0), nc = 4) dpen <- penalty_grad(W) #> Error in penalty_grad(W): could not find function "penalty_grad" dpen(R, clusters) #> Error in dpen(R, clusters): could not find function "dpen"

title: Moore-Penrose pseudo inverse — psolve
text: Computes Moore-Penrose inverse matrix. calculation done thanks article  : = L L^t (L zero-columns) : ^+ = L (L^t L)^-1 (L^t L)^-1 L^t

title: Moore-Penrose pseudo inverse — psolve
code: A <- matrix(c(1, 2, 3,               2, 5, 6,               3, 6, 9), nc = 3) psolve(A) #> Error in psolve(A): could not find function "psolve"

what: Step for the gradient descent — step_gradient
title: Step for the gradient descent — step_gradient
text: Step gradient descent

title: Step for the gradient descent — step_gradient
Step for the gradient descent — step_gradient
text: gamma d x d matrix : variogram matrix. weights d x d symmetric matrix zero diagonal. size_grid integer : size search grid optimal step. lambda positive number : weight penalty.

title: Step for the gradient descent — step_gradient
text: function clusters R matrix returns next step optimisation gradient descent algorithm.

title: Step for the gradient descent — step_gradient
code: R <- matrix(c(0.5, -1,               -1, -1), nr = 2) clusters <- list(c(1, 3), c(2,4)) W <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1,               1, 0, 1, 1,               1, 1, 0, 1,               1, 1, 1, 0), nc = 4) gamma <- matrix(c(0, 2, 1, 0,                   2, 0, 4, 1,                   1, 4, 0, 7,                   0, 1, 7, 0), nc = 4) f <- step_gradient(gamma, W, 0.5) #> Error in step_gradient(gamma, W, 0.5): could not find function "step_gradient" f(R, clusters) #> Error in f(R, clusters): could not find function "f"

Computation of the clustered weight matrix — weight_clustered

title: Computation of the clustered weight matrix — weight_clustered
text: function clusters : weight matrix pair clusters : W_kl = sum_(C_k) sum_(j C_l) w_ij

title: Computation of the clustered weight matrix — weight_clustered
code: clusters <- list(c(1,2,3), c(4,5)) W <- matrix(1:25, nc = 5) W_c <- weight_clustered(W) #> Error in weight_clustered(W): could not find function "weight_clustered" W_c(clusters) #> Error in W_c(clusters): could not find function "W_c"
